questions.questionText: How many sizes of headers are available in HTML by default?
questions.explanation: 6 headers are available in HTML by default ranging from h1 to h6.

questions.questionText: Which attribute is used to provide a unique name to an HTML element?
questions.explanation: An id is used to provide a unique name for an HTML element that can be used to identify it.

questions.questionText: What tag is used to render an image on a webpage?
questions.explanation: The img tag is used to display an image on a webpage.

questions.questionText: Which of the following tags is used to add a row to a table in HTML?
questions.explanation: <tr> is used to add a row to a table in HTML.

questions.questionText: What keyword is used to check whether a given property is valid or not?
questions.explanation: The in keyword is used to check whether the given property is valid or not in Javascript.

questions.questionText: When an operatorâ€™s value is NULL, the typeof returned by the unary operator is:
questions.explanation: Any NULL value of operator will always return typeof object.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is not a Javascript framework?
questions.explanation: Other than Cassandra, all the other options are Javascript frameworks.

questions.questionText: What keyword is used to declare an asynchronous function in Javascript?
questions.explanation: The async keyword is used to declare an asynchronous function in Javascript.

questions.questionText: Apart from <i> tag, which of the following tag is used to render a text in italics?
questions.explanation: The <em> tag is used to emphasize text, which puts same effect as <i> tag.
